intro: Parapteropyrum tibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is well-suited to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat. Parapteropyrum tibeticum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native ecosystem and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
